key_responsibilities: advising the Coalition’s leadership on communications and outreach efforts

working together with the Coalition’s Executive Director and Policy Coordinator, as well as the Coalition’s Co-Chair for Communications and Outreach and other Co-Chairs and their staff to develop strategic positions on policy and legislative issues
managing both the long-term strategic communications strategy and day-to-day press for the Coalition
serving as a resource to all Coalition Member offices to provide any communications counsel they may need
requirements: At least three to four years of previous professional communications experience
Experience at a college student media organization and/or a bachelor’s degree in journalism, public relations or another related field is a plus, but not required
Strong writing and editing skills as well as attention to detail
Ability to work well under the pressure of tight deadlines while also managing multiple major projects and approval processes at once
Ability to work independently as well as in team environments
Ability to develop and maintain relationships with print, digital and broadcast reporters
Existing relationships with members of the Capitol Hill press corps is a plus
Digital experience is a plus
A strong understanding of narrative and brand management
Ability to track news of the day and remain knowledgeable of issues the Coalition’s leadership may be expected to weigh in on publicly
Knowledge of legislative procedures
Ability to work amicably with a wide variety of personalities, to exercise discretion, to learn quickly, and to get the job done without needing to be reminded

office: Director of Financial Disclosure, Committee on Ethics
key_responsibilities: overseeing the Committee’s Financial Disclosure Office
managing a nonpartisan staff of attorneys and other professionals
reviewing and certifying financial statements
providing legal advice on a high volume of financial disclosure issues
educating and training Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: minimum of 5 years of experience with government ethics
outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
ability to build consensus
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

Experience in one or more of the following areas is also desirable: ethics counseling and training, accounting, auditing, investment management, taxation, corporate finance, securities law, and familiarity with Congress and its unique institutional prerogatives
Previous management experience preferred
salary: $161,700 to $172,500, with the possibility for discretionary bonuses
